newsitem.title: USA: Keane gets year 2000 contract from Alamo. [CORRECTED 17:50 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Keane gets year 2000 contract from Alamo. [CORRECTED 17:50 GMT]

text.p: Software company Keane Inc on Wednesday said it has been awarded a $6 million contract by Republic Industries Inc's Alamo Rent-A-Car Inc to find and fix any problems stemming from the Year 2000 bug.

The contract calls for Keane to complete an assessment of the client's mainframe systems and develop a strategic compliance plan for converting Alamo's 9.6 million lines of code and code remediation and testing, Keane said.

The Year 2000, or millennium, bug is a global programming problem by which many older computers and software programs will be unable to process two-digit dates correctly after December 31, 1999. When the year 2000 changes over, these systems may misinterpret the "00" date field as "1900," and crash or lose data.
